title: Commodore 64
summary: The Commodore 64, introduced in 1982, became the best-selling single computer model of all time. With its powerful graphics and sound capabilities, affordable price, and massive software library, it defined home computing for a generation.
significance: The C64 brought computing to the masses with an unprecedented combination of power and affordability. Its SID sound chip revolutionized computer music, and its sprite graphics made arcade-quality games possible at home. Over 17 million units were sold, making it a cultural phenomenon that introduced millions to programming through BASIC.
keyFigures: Jack Tramiel - Founder of Commodore, business strategy
Robert Yannes - Designer of the SID sound chip
Al Charpentier - Designer of the VIC-II graphics chip
